result.execSummary:
The defendant Iesha S Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution hearing scheduled for 08-25-2016 at 1:30 pm
Pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs and surcharges by 09-19-2016 or converts to a civil judgment. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Iesha S Grant

records.addlTxt: Restitution packet. vp
Bail refund packet

Assessment entered in error, correct case is 2015CM04128. DZ  Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $708.00 entered as ordered by the court on 09/08/2016  to pay $35.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 06/01/2018. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Kenturah E. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25478408 in court 2x on 4/27/16, 7/20/16.
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Kenyatta E. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25478407 in court 2x on 4/27/16, 7/20/16.
Order entered in error, correct case is 2015CM04128. DZ   Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs signed and filed.
Request for payment of witness fees prepared by the DA's Victim/Witness Services dated 8/26/16 for Kenyatta E. and Kenturah E. for 2 appearances each on 4/27/16, 7/20/16.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case set for Restitution Hearing. Parties stipulate to Restitution in the amount of $156.41 payable to Kenyatta E. due by 12/27/2016. Failure to pay will result in civil judgment subject to tax intercept.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 
Court ordered defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100.00 including costs and surcharges by 9-19-2016 or case converts to a civil judgment.

Parties request a restitution hearing.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Cynthia Davis, Branch 21 in Room 504 of the Courthouse.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final pretrial proceeded.  Arguments heard as to defendant's motion to admit evidence of prior bad acts.  Court places rulings on the record.  Case remains in a jury trial posture.  Jury trial remains scheduled for 7-20-2016 at 8:30 am, Branch 45.
Defendant's Motion to Admit Evidence of  Prior Bad Acts, filed.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for jury trial.  In-chambers discussion placed on the record.  Defense request to adjourn jury trial date, not objected to by state.  Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial to Branch 45.  Defense to file any motions by 5-03-2016.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm. Jury Trial scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final pretrial held. Case remains in a jury trial posture.  Jury trial remains scheduled for 4-27-2016 at 8:30 am, Branch 45.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court with attorney Robert J Hampton.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
State has turned over an offer and discovery.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of dangerous weapons or firearms, including pepper spray.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KAE (DOB 10/17/75) or KDE (DOB 11/14/76).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Iesha S Grant in court.  Jeffrey James Altenburg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM007486  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/10/2016
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
